p: Clinically, RSV infection often presents with respiratory symptoms like a cough, rhinorrhea, and difficulty breathing. As many as 97% of children are infected with RSV by age 2 [ 17]. RSV has also been associated with the development of severe illnesses and is considered the most common viral cause of pneumonia among children aged <5 years [ 18]. In Nicaragua, the respiratory illness season can last from June through February. While the seasonality of influenza in Nicaragua has been documented [ 19], the seasonality of RSV and other respiratory viruses is not well-defined.
